alert.note: Alert for Newberry; Union (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:44AM EST until January 13 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in South Carolina... Enoree River At Whitmire affecting Newberry and Union Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Enoree River at Whitmire. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, River bottomland near and downstream from Whitmire become flooded. At 28.0 feet, The Coleman Aughtry Road along the river becomes flooded. Do not drive into flooded roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 24.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 25.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 28.1 feet early Thursday afternoon. It is expected to fall below flood stage on Friday. - Flood stage is 25.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1045 PM EST.
